title: Ticket #6505: HTCondor marks VM universe offline if disk image corrupted
description:
For example, if no-such-file.qcow2 exists but has zero length, the VMGahpLog records: 

12/11/17 15:30:52 CreateKvmVMConfigFile
12/11/17 15:30:53 Failed to create libvirt domain: internal error: process exited while connecting to monitor: \
qemu-system-x86_64: -drive file=/var/lib/libvirt/images/no-such-file.qcow2,if=none,id=drive-ide0-0-0,format=qcow2: \
could not open disk image /var/lib/libvirt/images/no-such-file.qcow2: Image is not in qcow2 format

TJ suggested checking for a zero-length file wherever we already check to see if the file exists. My thought was to recognize this error as being job-specific (and therefore put the job on hold), rather than an internal error as suggested by the log message.
